content.description: Three identical spheres are thrown from the same height above the ground. Sphere X is thrown vertically up, sphere Y is thrown horizontally, and sphere Z is thrown vertically down, as shown in figures 1, 2, and 3 above, respectively. All three spheres are thrown with the same speed. Air resistance is negligible.
content.question: Assume the spheres collide elastically with the ground. Which of the following ranks the spheres based on the rebound height after they collide with the ground?

topic.text: 1.5: Motion in Two or Three Dimensions

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
